V3¶

Files¶

v3/files
v3/files

Depending on the verb, this will:

  • post a file (POST).

  • download a file (GET).

  • delete a file (DELETE).

v3/files?path= [GET]

Download a file from the FTP Server.

Param

‘path’ : The path to the file

Returns

HTTP Response with JSON Object:

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 21:15:59 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Cache-Control: public
< Content-Transfer-Encoding: Binary
< Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=file.txt
< Content-Length: 125
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"File successfully get",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "name":"file.txt",
                "content":"this is file1.txt."
        }
}
v3/files [DELETE]

Delete a file from the FTP Server. Path need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘path’ : The path to the file

Returns

HTTP Response :

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Mon, 31 Jan 2022 16:14:42 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 108
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"File successfully delete",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "path":"./wwwhome/File2.txt"
        }
}
v3/files [POST]

Upload a file in the FTP Server. Path and file need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘path’ : The path to the directory where you want the file to be in.

Param

‘file’ : The file to be uploaded.

Returns

HTTP Response with JSON Object:

  • 201 Created.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 201 CREATED
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:11:44 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 225
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"201",
        "message":"File successfully posted",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "path":"./wwwhome/ourAPI.txt",
                "content":"Our REST API is called FTP over HTTP.\n
                           From HTTP Request, we \"translate\"
                           them to request the FTP server."
        }
}
v3/files/move [POST]

Move a file from a directory to another. The parameters need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘pathSrc’ : The path to the directory where the file is.

Param

‘pathDst’ : The path to the directory where you want to move the file.

Param

‘filename’ : The name of the file.

Returns

HTTP Response with JSON Object :

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:16:03 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 157
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"File successfully moved",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "path":"./ourAPI.txt",
                "previousPath":"./wwwhome/ourAPI.txt"
        }
}
v3/files/rename [POST]

Rename a file. The parameters need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘path’ : The path to the directory of the file.

Param

‘previousName’ : The previous name of the file.

Param

‘newName’ : The new name of the file.

Returns

HTTP Response :

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:21:41 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 154
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"File successfully renamed",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "path":"./wwwhome/API.txt",
                "previousName":"ourAPI.txt",
                "newName":"API.txt"
        }
}

Dirs¶

v3/dirs
v3/dirs

Depending on the verb, this will:

  • create a new directory (POST)

  • delete a directory and it’s content (DELETE)

v3/dirs [POST]

Create a new directory (equivalent to a mkdir). The path need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘path’ : The path with the new directory included.

Returns

HTTP Response :

  • 201 Created.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 201 CREATED
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:23:39 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 125
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"201",
        "message":"Directory created",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "directory":
        {
                "path":"./directory",
                "directoryName":"directory"
        }
}
v3/dirs [DELETE]

Remove a directory (equivalent to a rmdir). The path need to be precised in the body.

This will remove all the files and directory inside the directory that is deleted.

Param

‘path’ : Path of the directory to delete

Returns

HTTP Response :

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Mon, 31 Jan 2022 16:18:47 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 149
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"Directory successfully deleted",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "directory":
        {
                "path":"./wwwhome/Directory1",
                "directoryName":"Directory1"
        }
}
v3/dirs/ls?path= [GET]

List all elements of the directory with their names.

param

‘path’ : Path to the directory

returns

HTTP Response with JSON Object

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

Note

If no path has been specified this will return the list of elements in the root (understand basic) directory

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:25:36 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 501
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"ls successfully executed",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "ls":
        [
                {
                        "name":"Directory1",
                        "type":"dir"
                },
                {
                        "name":"Directory2",
                        "type":"dir"
                },
                {
                        "name":"My Documents",
                        "type":"dir"
                },
                {
                        "name":"API.txt",
                        "type":"file"
                },
                {
                        "name":"file.pdf",
                        "type":"file"
                },
                {
                        "name":"File.txt",
                        "type":"file"
                },
                {
                        "name":"File2.txt",
                        "type":"file"
                }
        ]
}
v3/dirs/lsl?path= [GET]

List all the directory and the file with more information. (equivalent to a ls -l)

Param

‘path’ : Path to the directory

Returns

HTTP Response with JSON Object

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

Note

If no path has been specified this will return the list of elements in the root (understand basic) directory

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:42:44 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 1102
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"ls -l successfully executed",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "ls":
        [
                {
                        "name":"Directory1",
                        "size":"0",
                        "type":"dir",
                        "perm":"el",
                        "modify":"20220124141105"
                },
                {
                        "name":"Directory2",
                        "size":"0",
                        "type":"dir",
                        "perm":"el",
                        "modify":"20220124141112"
                },
                {
                        "name":"My Documents",
                        "size":"138",
                        "type":"dir",
                        "perm":"el",
                        "modify":"20220121153436"
                },
                {
                        "name":"API.txt",
                        "size":"103",
                        "type":"file",
                        "perm":"r",
                        "modify":"20220129221145"
                },
                {
                        "name":"file.pdf",
                        "size":"376739",
                        "type":"file",
                        "perm":"r",
                        "modify":"20220129215913"
                },
                {
                        "name":"File.txt",
                        "size":"15",
                        "type":"file",
                        "perm":"r",
                        "modify":"20220129220344"
                },
                {
                        "name":"File2.txt",
                        "size":"111",
                        "type":"file",
                        "perm":"r",
                        "modify":"20220124141018"
                },
                {
                        "name":"File3.txt",
                        "size":"71",
                        "type":"file",
                        "perm":"r",
                        "modify":"20220124141051"
                }
        ]
}
v3/dirs/pwd [GET]

Return the current path to the current directory.

Returns

HTTP Response with JSON Object

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:50:04 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 57
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"OK",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "pwd":"/"
}
v3/files/rename [POST]

Rename a directory. The parameters need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘path’ : The path to the directory of the directory.

Param

‘previousName’ : The previous name of the directory.

Param

‘newName’ : The new name of the directory.

Returns

HTTP Response :

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Mon, 31 Jan 2022 16:24:36 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 166
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"File successfully renamed",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "path":"./wwwhome/Directory",
                "previousName":"DirectoryToRename",
                "newName":"Directory"
        }
}
v3/dirs/move [POST]

Move a directory from a directory to another. The parameters need to be precised in the body.

Param

‘pathSrc’ : The path to the directory where the directory is.

Param

‘pathDst’ : The path to the directory where you want to move the directory.

Param

‘filename’ : The name of the directory.

Returns

HTTP Response :

  • 200 OK.

  • 400 Bad Request.

  • 404 Not Found.

  • 406 Not Acceptable

< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:53:10 GMT
< Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Unix) OpenSSL/1.1.1m PHP/8.0.14 mod_perl/2.0.11 Perl/v5.32.1
< X-Powered-By: PHP/8.0.14
< Content-Length: 156
< Content-Type: application/json
<
{
        "code":"200",
        "message":"File successfully moved",
        "status":"SUCCESS",
        "file":
        {
                "path":"./wwwhome/Directory1/Directory2",
                "previousPath":"./wwwhome/Directory2"
        }
}
